column5: Ahhh... the inevitable "guest" comment. Everyone here was joking, but seriously, you wouldn't trade a single American thing for any of Canada? How about any one Kardashian for Dan Aykroyd? You can't tell me you wouldn't make that trade. LOL Lighten up, we're all joking and wishing it was summer time! I'm sorry to continue with the hijacking of this thread. I really was meaning to stop.

I would suggest that Wisconsin should do the same thing. Our state government is completely in the hands of big donors, many who don't even live in Wisconsin. So, we gut education, health care, protective services, and reward big donors. ok I will shut up now.
Mattice Lake Outfitters charges in Canadian Funds, too. Was very pleasantly surprised by this last summer. There are so many reasons to take a trip with this outfitter.........
I would make them take Detroit with those states to close the deal......
Well, they don't call your country "CanaDA" for nothing...........
Not on your life - Michael Moore, Rosie O'Donnell etc. live in California

Anti-American Political posts are not allowed on this forum...if you don't like the way the U.S. does things , keep your Canadian thoughts to yourself Gordon....[/QUOTE]not sure, but last I checked, Walleye Central physical location was in Canada

I am an American so I wouldn't trade a single American thing for any of Canada. Those of you so called Americans who think you are better that other Americans and want to be in Canada should just do so -- move there and become Canadians..
Can we start a gofundme account to buy "move there" a sense of humor?

Not sure this post is relevant anymore but there are several outfitters in Nakina that charge in Canadian dollars but they also will accept US dollars at the current exchange rate as a curtesy to their US customers... When in Canada do as the Canadians do, pay in Canadian funds!
I just wish Canadians would shut the dang door come November. Quit letting that cold air come down here and freeze our arse off! LOL!
i will never go a resort that charges in u.s. funds
I'm in......I have about $130.00 in Loonies left from last year's trip. PjShorthorn
If we give Chicago to Canada how do they handle the gun thingy? By giving Chicago to Canada would it be considered a "act of war" towards Canada?
It's outdated, but mostly relevant still. Primarily outposts though.http://www.lineonfishing.com/index.p...-strong-dollar

[QUOTE=v-bay gord;5252545]Seems like it won't be long till we have to deal with Americans paying in Russian currency....... Anti-American Political posts are not allowed on this forum...if you don't like the way the U.S. does things , keep your Canadian thoughts to yourself Gordon....

[QUOTE=Crackback;5254266]I think Gord is offering a free extra night at his camp for anyone wearing a Trump tee shirt this year. Plus a days guided fishing if you have a pair of six guns on your waist!

I don't have any resorts to recommend for you. I just think it's unfair that some guys on this forum think it's ok to hijack a thread. Out of the now 25 posts to his thread the OP has had only 5 that answered his question. The rest are about a bunch of BS that has no bearing on the original poster's question. C'mon guys take that crap and post it on the general discussion board! Just my opinion.

[QUOTE=Crackback;5254266]Make sure to get your message out to all of the consulates worldwide........along with instructions to all WC members that they should use the search function for their questions instead of asking anyone's opinions and experiences..........ggggggeeeeeezzzzzzz PjShorthorn
Welcome to cabin fever time at Walleye Central.
Lol. It must be "that time of the year" for WC. I guess I'm contributing to the hijacking myself now. Sorry OP.
You only want Northwestern Ontario, if you agree to that I'm in.
Here's one that I know. http://bonnybay.com/
Lukinto Lake Lodge near Longlac charges in Canadian dollars.
How about calling it the "Ameribuck"
Personally... I'd vote for a California/Oregon/Washington trade for Ontario. Straight up... 3 for 1.

Those states have too big of economies to get rid of. Dump some of the deadbeat states like Kansas, Wyoming, Alabama and Mississippi. They're a net loss to the money making states so it's even more of a win for the rest of us.
Heck,....let's throw Illinois in there too !!!!

California is absolutely killing the US. They're causing an enormous drought, produce almost nothing other than vacationing and wine... States with large deposits of natural resources and states that are large food producers are better than overpopulated economic states in my opinion. Bear... I would agree on Illinois, but it'd be land locked.
I wouldn't trade away any of our states, but sure would trade away many of our cities! But I doubt Canada would want them.
Illinois--consider it a gift with no quid pro quo required.
white river air charges in canadian funds

Hummm...In 2015, the top 10 agricultural producing States, in terms of cash receipts were (in descending order): California, Iowa, Texas, Nebraska, Minnesota, Illinois, Kansas, North Carolina, Wisconsin, and Indiana.Plus...California's economy would rank 5th in the world.B-
What are the names of some resorts that do charge in Canadian currency with the exchange being so good right now?
Most of the outfitters in the province of Quebec charge in Canadian$
Off the top of my head: Indianhead Lodge Snake Bay LOTW Miles Bay Camp Miles Bay LOTW White Pine Lodge Snake Bay LOTW
I don't like outfitters that charge in Canadian. It's unAmerican.
We should just annex Ontario, Manitoba and Saskatchewan into the US.

Seems like it won't be long till we have to deal with Americans paying in Russian currency.......oh, and by the way, on Eagle Lake two resorts that charge in Canadian $ are Cedar Point Lodge and Vermilion Bay Lodge .
I'm more inclined to have Michigan cecede and join Ontarioüòè
I have long been a proponent of a common currency between the two countries in order to avoid the exchange rate gymnastics. It should be called the Northo.
Good idea, but please wait until after January 16th.

I was thinking about that after I posted--what should we give up in return? Initial thought is New Jersey but there's no common border. Despite it being the home of the Vikings, Minnesota is too nice a state to give away. All things considered, I think New York in exchange for the three above mentioned provinces would be a nice trade. Maybe throw in the upper peninsula of Michigan.
